No Poverty.reason: The course applies calculus to 'business and economics,' which are fields directly related to analyzing and addressing poverty, although this is an inferred application.
evidence: apply Calculus to real-world problems such as business and economics

Quality Education.reason: As a foundational university course, it aims to develop 'critical thinking, quantitative skills and empirical reasoning skills,' which are central to quality education.
evidence: This course will develop the ability of critical thinking, quantitative skills and empirical reasoning skills.

Decent Work and Economic Growth.reason: The course applies calculus to 'business and economics' and develops 'quantitative skills,' which are fundamental for analyzing economic growth and preparing students for professional work.
evidence: apply Calculus to real-world problems such as business and economics
develop the ability of critical thinking, quantitative skills and empirical reasoning skills

Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure.reason: Calculus is a foundational mathematical tool for innovation and problem-solving, which is supported by the course's objective to develop 'problem solving' and 'quantitative skills.'

Responsible Consumption and Production.reason: A stated core competency is to 'understand and be able to identify... sustainability issues,' which directly relates to this SDG, especially in business and economic applications like optimization.
evidence: Students will understand and be able to identify ethics, social responsibility, and sustainability issues.

Peace, Justice and Strong Institutions.reason: A core competency is for students to 'understand and be able to identify ethics, social responsibility,' which are foundational concepts for justice and strong institutions.
evidence: Students will understand and be able to identify ethics, social responsibility, and sustainability issues.

Partnerships for the Goals.reason: The course aims to develop 'Teamwork and leadership skills,' which is a necessary component for forming partnerships, though the link is indirect.
evidence: Students will be able to work effectively in teams as well as develop leadership skills.
